revised_title: Experimental Proof of the Influence of Change of Condition on Vapour-Pressure
tldr: The authors provide experimental evidence to support Professor James Thomson's theory that the pressure exerted by the vapor of a solid substance at a given temperature is less than that of the vapor of the substance in the liquid form at the same temperature. They demonstrate this through experiments with camphor, benzene, acetic acid, and water, and propose a new method for determining the vapor pressures of solids and liquids.
